alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:09AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Fayette, western Meriwether, eastern Heard, Troup, Coweta and northern Harris Counties through NOON EDT... At 1108 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Handy to near Cusseta, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, LaGrange, Hamilton, Franklin, Greenville, Peachtree City, West Point, Senoia, Hogansville, Grantville, Pine Mountain, Luthersville, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, Haralson, Lone Oak, East Newnan, Corinth, and Pine Mountain-Callaway Gardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
